member.name: T:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator
member.summary: Represents a decorator which allows to flash a brush by modifying his opacity.

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Attack
member.summary:
Gets or sets the attack-time (in seconds) of the decorator. (default: 0.2)
This is close to a synthesizer envelope. (See as reference)

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Decay
member.summary:
Gets or sets the decay-time (in seconds) of the decorator. (default: 0)
This is close to a synthesizer envelope. (See as reference)

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Sustain
member.summary:
Gets or sets the sustain-time (in seconds) of the decorator. (default: 0.3)
This is close to a synthesizer envelope. (See as reference)
Note that this value for naming reasons represents the time NOT the level.

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Release
member.summary:
Gets or sets the release-time (in seconds) of the decorator. (default: 0.2)
This is close to a synthesizer envelope. (See as reference)

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.AttackValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the level to which the oppacity (percentage) should raise in the attack-cycle. (default: 1);

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.SustainValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the level at which the oppacity (percentage) should stay in the sustain-cycle. (default: 1);

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.PauseValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the level at which the oppacity (percentage) should stay in the pause-cycle. (default: 0);

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval (in seconds) in which the decorator should repeat (if repetition is enabled). (default: 1)

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.Repetitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of repetitions the decorator should do until it's finished. Zero means infinite. (default: 0)

member.name: M:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.FlashDecorator.#ctor(RGB.NET.Core.RGBSurface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new from the specified xml.
member.param: The surface this decorator belongs to.
A value indicating if the decorator should be updated if it is disabled.

member.name: T:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.IGradientDecorator
member.summary: Represents a basic decorator decorating a .

member.name: T:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.MoveGradientDecorator
member.summary: Represents a decorator which allows to move an by modifying his offset.

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.MoveGradientDecorator.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction the is moved. True leads to an offset-increment (normaly moving to the right), false to an offset-decrement (normaly moving to the left).

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.MoveGradientDecorator.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed of the movement in units per second. The meaning of units differs for the different , but 360 units will always be one complete cycle: : 360 unit = 1 offset. : 1 unit = 1 degree.

member.name: M:RGB.NET.Presets.Decorators.MoveGradientDecorator.#ctor(RGB.NET.Core.RGBSurface,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The surface this decorator belongs to.
The speed of the movement in units per second. The meaning of units differs for the different but 360 units will always be one complete cycle: : 360 unit = 1 offset. : 1 unit = 1 degree.
The direction the is moved. True leads to an offset-increment (normaly moving to the right), false to an offset-decrement (normaly moving to the left).

member.summary: Gets a list of the stops used by this .

member.name: P:RGB.NET.Presets.Textures.Gradients.AbstractGradient.WrapGradient
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Gradient wraps around if there isn't a second stop to take. Example: There is a stop at offset 0.0, 0.5 and 0.75. Without wrapping offset 1.0 will be calculated the same as 0.75; with wrapping it would be the same as 0.0.

The stops with which the gradient should be initialized.
